original: @/_@/sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs////_@/_/@/_sgrol ma nor sbyin ma bzhugs so//_@##/_/rgya gar skad du/_d+ha
analyzed: @/_@/sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs////_@/_/@/_sgrol ma nor sbyin ma bzhugs so//_@##/_/rgya gar skad du/_d+ha
translated: The Sadhana of Dhanada Tara🔽In Sanskrit:🔽Dhanadatta-sadhana🔽In Tibetan:

original: na da ta ra sa d+ha na/_bod skad du/_sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs/_'phags🔽ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/de nas bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma'i dkyil
analyzed: na da ta ra sa d+ha na/_bod skad du/_sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs/_'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/de nas bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma'i dkyil
translated: Drolma Norjinma'i Drupta🔽Homage to Noble Tara!

original: 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim pa ni mdor bsdus pa bri bar bya'o/_/dang por
analyzed: 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim pa ni mdor bsdus pa bri bar bya'o/_/dang por
translated: Now, I will write a brief description of the stages of the mandala circle of the Blessed Lady Tara.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma bsgom pa'i bdag nyid kyi rigs kyi bus mal nas
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma bsgom pa'i bdag nyid kyi rigs kyi bus mal nas
translated: First, the son of good family who is intent on meditating on the Blessed Lady Tara, when he rises from his bed,

original: ldang ba'i dus su/_rang gi snying gar a las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la
analyzed: ldang ba'i dus su/_rang gi snying gar a las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la
translated: should visualize at his heart center an A, from which arises a moon mandala,🔽on which is a TAM syllable, shining with radiating light rays.

original: tam yig tu snang ba'i 'od zer 'phro ba bsgoms nas/_de las 'od zer 'phros
analyzed: tam yig tu snang ba'i 'od zer 'phro ba bsgoms nas/_de las 'od zer 'phros
translated: From that, light rays radiate

original: pas lha mo sgrol mas gtsho mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mdun du
analyzed: pas lha mo sgrol mas gtsho mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mdun du
translated: and all the Tathagatas, who are the benefactors of the goddess Tara, are invited to come before him.

original: bltas nas/_me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yid kyi rang bzhin gyi
analyzed: bltas nas/_me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yid kyi rang bzhin gyi
translated: Then, with flowers, incense, and so forth, he should make mental offerings

original: mchod pa bya'o/_/de de la gnas pa'i sems kho nas langs nas/_kha bkru ba la
analyzed: mchod pa bya'o/_/de de la gnas pa'i sems kho nas langs nas/_kha bkru ba la
translated: Make offerings to them.🔽Then, rising from that state of mind, wash your face and so forth,🔽and then enter the meditation hut.

original: sogs pa sngon du byas te/_bsam gtan gyi khang par byams pa dang snying rje'i
analyzed: sogs pa sngon du byas te/_bsam gtan gyi khang par byams pa dang snying rje'i
translated: There, with loving kindness and compassion,

original: sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs
analyzed: sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs
translated: The Sadhana of Wealth-Giver Tara

original: bdag nyid kyis/_sna'i rtshe mo dang 'brel par blta bas bsam gtan dang 'brel🔽ba'i phyag rgyas/_om swa b+ha wa shud d+has+sarba d+harmaswa b+ha wa shun+d+ho\u0f85ham/_om swa b+ha wa
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis/_sna'i rtshe mo dang 'brel par blta bas bsam gtan dang 'brel ba'i phyag rgyas/_om swa b+ha wa shud d+has+sarba d+harmaswa b+ha wa shun+d+ho\u0f85ham/_om swa b+ha wa
translated: Then, with the nose-consciousness related to the view, the mudra related to meditation,🔽and the tongue-consciousness related to mantra,

original: shu n+yas+sarba d+harmas  swa b+ha wa shu spyo ham/_om shu n+ya ti dz+nya na badzra swa b+ha wat+ma ko\u0f85ham/
analyzed: shu n+yas+sarba d+harmas  swa b+ha wa shu spyo ham/_om shu n+ya ti dz+nya na badzra swa b+ha wat+ma ko\u0f85ham/
translated: recite the mantra: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ.🔽Oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: zhes pa'i sngags dran pa sngon du 'gro bas khams gsum po thams cad dang rang gi
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags dran pa sngon du 'gro bas khams gsum po thams cad dang rang gi
translated: With this mantra recitation as a preliminary, imagine that the entire three realms and your own

original: lus stong pa nyid du bsam nas/_rang gi bdag nyid me long gi gzugs brnyan
analyzed: lus stong pa nyid du bsam nas/_rang gi bdag nyid me long gi gzugs brnyan
translated: body are emptiness. Then, regard your own self as being like a reflection in a mirror.

original: dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o/_/de'i rjes su rang gi snying ga'i pad mar a las
analyzed: dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o/_/de'i rjes su rang gi snying ga'i pad mar a las
translated: After that, in the lotus of your heart, from an A arises a moon disc,

original: skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la tam yig gi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i bla ma
analyzed: skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la tam yig gi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i bla ma
translated: Visualize the guru, buddhas, and bodhisattvas in front of you,

original: dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mdun du bltas te mchod yon
analyzed: dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mdun du bltas te mchod yon
translated: invited by light rays from the syllable tam in the moon mandala in your🔽heart.🔽Make offerings to them with mental offerings of water for

original: dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis yid kyi rang bzhin gyi mchod pas mchod par
analyzed: dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis yid kyi rang bzhin gyi mchod pas mchod par
translated: drinking, flowers, and so forth.🔽The verses for this are:

original: bya'o/_/de la tshhigs su bcad pa ni/_om sangs rgyas kun la bdag phyag
analyzed: bya'o/_/de la tshhigs su bcad pa ni/_om sangs rgyas kun la bdag phyag
translated: I pay homage to all the buddhas,🔽to the Dharma taught by the Victorious One,

original: 'tshhal/_/rgyal bas gsungs pa'i chos dang ni/_/dge 'dun tshhul khrims
analyzed: 'tshhal/_/rgyal bas gsungs pa'i chos dang ni/_/dge 'dun tshhul khrims
translated: and to the Sangha, the holders of excellent ethical discipline.

original: bzang ldan pa/_/dkon mchog gsum po khyed la 'dud/_/dkon mchog
analyzed: bzang ldan pa/_/dkon mchog gsum po khyed la 'dud/_/dkon mchog
translated: I bow to you, the Three Jewels.🔽I go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/_/sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags/_/'gro
analyzed: gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/_/sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags/_/'gro
translated: I confess each and every nonvirtue.🔽I rejoice in the virtue of beings.

original: ba'i dge la rje yi rang /_/sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis bzung /_/sangs
analyzed: ba'i dge la rje yi rang /_/sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis bzung /_/sangs
translated: I hold in my mind the enlightenment of the buddhas.🔽I go for refuge until enlightenment

original: rgyas chos dang tshhogs mchog la/_/byang chub bar du skyabs su mchi/_/rang
analyzed: rgyas chos dang tshhogs mchog la/_/byang chub bar du skyabs su mchi/_/rang
translated: to the Buddha, Dharma, and supreme Sangha.🔽I go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: gzhan don ni rab sgrub phyir/_/byang chub sems ni bskyed par bgyi/_/byang
analyzed: gzhan don ni rab sgrub phyir/_/byang chub sems ni bskyed par bgyi/_/byang
translated: I will generate the awakening mind.🔽Having generated the supreme awakening mind,

original: chub mchog gi sems ni bskyed bgyis nas/_/sems can thams cad bdag gi
analyzed: chub mchog gi sems ni bskyed bgyis nas/_/sems can thams cad bdag gi
translated: I will invite all sentient beings to be my guests.

original: 'gron du gnyer/_/byang chub spyod mchog yid 'ong spyad par bgyi/_/'gro la
analyzed: 'gron du gnyer/_/byang chub spyod mchog yid 'ong spyad par bgyi/_/'gro la
translated: I will engage in the delightful conduct of awakening🔽and attain buddhahood for the benefit of migrating beings.

original: phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog_/ces pa la sogs pa smon lam gyi mthar
analyzed: phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog_/ces pa la sogs pa smon lam gyi mthar
translated: After making such aspirations,

original: thug pa byas la/_lha mo sgrol mas gtsho mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de thams
analyzed: thug pa byas la/_lha mo sgrol mas gtsho mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de thams
translated: the thus-gone ones who have performed the deeds of the goddess Tārā

original: cad rang gi lus la gzhug go/_/'di ni bsod nams kyi tshhogs spel ba'i cho ga'o/
analyzed: cad rang gi lus la gzhug go/_/'di ni bsod nams kyi tshhogs spel ba'i cho ga'o/
translated: should all be absorbed into one’s body. This is the ritual for increasing the accumulation of merit.

original: de nas ye shes kyi tshhogs rdzogs pa'i don du cho ga bri bar bya ste/_pam las skyes🔽pa'i pad+mar re las skyes pa'i nyi ma la hum las skyes pa'i bgegs mthar byed drag
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi tshhogs rdzogs pa'i don du cho ga bri bar bya ste/_pam las skyes pa'i pad+mar re las skyes pa'i nyi ma la hum las skyes pa'i bgegs mthar byed drag
translated: Next, in order to perfect the accumulation of wisdom, one should perform the following ritual.

original: po'i gzugs can g.yon brkyang gis gnas pa/_g.yas na rdo rje 'dzin pa/
analyzed: po'i gzugs can g.yon brkyang gis gnas pa/_g.yas na rdo rje 'dzin pa/
translated: From the syllable paṃ arises a lotus, upon which from the syllable re arises a sun. Upon that, from the syllable hūṃ arises a wrathful Vighnāntakṛt, standing with his left leg outstretched. In his right hand he holds a vajra.

original: g.yon pa sdigs 'dzub can/_mdog nag po zhal cig spyan gsum pa bsgom par
analyzed: g.yon pa sdigs 'dzub can/_mdog nag po zhal cig spyan gsum pa bsgom par
translated: He is black, with one face and three eyes, and he makes a threatening gesture with his left hand.

original: bya'o/_/de la sngags ni/_om a mr-i te ha na ha na sarba big+han da ha da ha sarba
analyzed: bya'o/_/de la sngags ni/_om a mr-i te ha na ha na sarba big+han da ha da ha sarba
translated: The mantra is: Oṃ amṛte hana hana sarva-vighnān dāha dāha sarva-pāpān hūṃ phaṭ.

original: pa pan hu~m phat/_ces pa bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i sngags so/_/de'i🔽rjes su/_lo r-i bam sam zhes pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams kyis/_rlung dang me
analyzed: pa pan hu~m phat/_ces pa bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i sngags so/_/de'i rjes su/_lo r-i bam sam zhes pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams kyis/_rlung dang me
translated: This mantra pacifies the obstructors.🔽After that, the seed syllables lo, ri, va, and sa should be visualized as the mandalas of wind, fire, water, and earth.

original: dang chu dang sa'i dkyil 'khor rnams bsam par bya'o/_/de nas rdo rje'i sa la🔽sogs pa bya'o/_/de la sngags ni/_om me di ni badzi b+ha wa ban d+ha hum/_om badzra
analyzed: dang chu dang sa'i dkyil 'khor rnams bsam par bya'o/_/de nas rdo rje'i sa la sogs pa bya'o/_/de la sngags ni/_om me di ni badzi b+ha wa ban d+ha hum/_om badzra
translated: Then, the vajra ground and so forth should be visualized.

original: pany+dza _ra hu~m pi /_om badzra bi ta na hu~m dzi hum/_om badzra sha ra dza la tram sham tram/
analyzed: pany+dza _ra hu~m pi /_om badzra bi ta na hu~m dzi hum/_om badzra sha ra dza la tram sham tram/
translated: The mantras are: Oṃ vajra-pāṇi-bhava-vaṃda hūṃ. Oṃ vajra-pāṇi-piba hūṃ. Oṃ vajra-pāṇi-jighra hūṃ. Oṃ vajra-pāṇi-sarva-buddha-kṣetra-saṃdhāraṇa-traṃ śaṃ traṃ.🔽Oṃ vajra-jñāna-nalina-laṃkāra hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ.

original: om badzra dz+nya la na larka hum hum hum/_'di ltar bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms nas/
analyzed: om badzra dz+nya la na larka hum hum hum/_'di ltar bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms nas/
translated: Having meditated on the protection wheel in this way,

original: phu yig las skyes pa'i ri rab la a las skyes pa'i pad+ma la/_rgyu yig las skyes
analyzed: phu yig las skyes pa'i ri rab la a las skyes pa'i pad+ma la/_rgyu yig las skyes
translated: The mountain is born from the syllable phu, and the lotus is born from the syllable a. The palace is born from the syllable gya.

original: pa'i khang pa rtshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa rta
analyzed: pa'i khang pa rtshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa rta
translated: It is a four-sided, four-doored palace with four porticos, the nature of Vairocana.

original: babs bzhis brgyan pa/_do shal dang do shal phyed pa dang me tog gi phreng ba dang me tog la sogs pas brgyan pa de'i dbus su sna tshhogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa/
analyzed: babs bzhis brgyan pa/_do shal dang do shal phyed pa dang me tog gi phreng ba dang me tog la sogs pas brgyan pa de'i dbus su sna tshhogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa/
translated: It is adorned with necklaces, half-necklaces, flower garlands, flowers, and so on. In the center of that is an eight-petaled multicolored lotus.

original: sgo bzhir yang sna tshhogs pad ma rnams so/_/dbus su gnas pa'i sna tshhogs pad+ma
analyzed: sgo bzhir yang sna tshhogs pad ma rnams so/_/dbus su gnas pa'i sna tshhogs pad+ma
translated: There are also multicolored lotuses at the four doors.

original: las skyes pa'i zla ba la rang gi lus tam yig gis sa bon las byung ba'i lha mo sgrol
analyzed: las skyes pa'i zla ba la rang gi lus tam yig gis sa bon las byung ba'i lha mo sgrol
translated: In the center, on a multicolored lotus born from the syllable taṃ, is a moon, upon which is one’s body as the seed syllable taṃ.

original: ma'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid 'od kyi snang ba zhal cig spyan gnyis phyag bzhi ma/
analyzed: ma'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid 'od kyi snang ba zhal cig spyan gnyis phyag bzhi ma/
translated: From that arises the goddess Tārā, whose nature is light. She has one face, two eyes, and four arms.

original: sngo ljang sems dpa'i dkyil krung can/_g.yas pa mchog sbyin dang bgrang phreng
analyzed: sngo ljang sems dpa'i dkyil krung can/_g.yas pa mchog sbyin dang bgrang phreng
translated: She is blue-green and sits in the sattvaparyaṅka posture. Her right hands make the boon-granting and rosary gestures.

original: 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa ut+pa la dang po tis mtshhan pa bsgom par bya'o/_/de'i
analyzed: 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa ut+pa la dang po tis mtshhan pa bsgom par bya'o/_/de'i
translated: and a lotus and book in the left.🔽In his heart is a TAM syllable.

original: thugs gar tram yig go/_/de las byung ba'i yi ge gsum ni om kha dog dkar po🔽sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs🔽rnam par snang mdzad ni spyi bor bsgom par bya'o/_/ah_yig kha dog dmar po
analyzed: thugs gar tram yig go/_/de las byung ba'i yi ge gsum ni om kha dog dkar po sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs rnam par snang mdzad ni spyi bor bsgom par bya'o/_/ah_yig kha dog dmar po
translated: The three syllables that come from that are an white OM,🔽a red AH,🔽and a green HUM.🔽Vairochana is meditated on the head.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa ni kha'i nang du bsgom par bya'o/_/hum yig kha dog ljang gu🔽don yod grub pa ni snying gar bsgom par bya'o/_/'dir sngags ni/_om sarba ta
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa ni kha'i nang du bsgom par bya'o/_/hum yig kha dog ljang gu don yod grub pa ni snying gar bsgom par bya'o/_/'dir sngags ni/_om sarba ta
translated: Amitabha is meditated in the mouth.🔽Amoghasiddhi is meditated in the heart.🔽The mantra here is OM SARVA TATHAGATA KAYA VAK CITTA VAJRA SVABHAVA ATMAKO.

original: tha ga ta ka ya wa_ka tshit+ta badzra swa b+ha wat+ma ko/_de nas rang gi lus la sngags
analyzed: tha ga ta ka ya wa_ka tshit+ta badzra swa b+ha wat+ma ko/_de nas rang gi lus la sngags
translated: Then, the mantra is placed on one's body:

original: dgod pa ni/_spyi bor om/_dpral bar ta/_mig dag tu re/_sna'i rtshe mor
analyzed: dgod pa ni/_spyi bor om/_dpral bar ta/_mig dag tu re/_sna'i rtshe mor
translated: an OM on the head, a TA on the forehead, a RE on the eyes, a TU on the nose,

original: tu/_mgrin par t+ta/_snying gar re/_lte bar tu/_gsang bar re/_pus
analyzed: tu/_mgrin par t+ta/_snying gar re/_lte bar tu/_gsang bar re/_pus
translated: a TA on the throat, a RE on the heart, a TU on the navel, a RE on the secret place,🔽and a HUM on the soles of the feet.

original: mo dag la swa/_rkang pa dag la ha/_'di ltar bkod pa'i sngags kyi yi ge🔽rnams kyis rang gi lus sgrol ma'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o/_/de'i rjes su/
analyzed: mo dag la swa/_rkang pa dag la ha/_'di ltar bkod pa'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyis rang gi lus sgrol ma'i rnam par bsgom par bya'o/_/de'i rjes su/
translated: The syllables of the mantra are arranged in this way.🔽After that, the thirteen syllables that arise from the syllable tam are

original: tam yig de las byung ba'i yi ge bcu gsum rnams ni/_kham/_hum/_tram/_hrih/_om/
analyzed: tam yig de las byung ba'i yi ge bcu gsum rnams ni/_kham/_hum/_tram/_hrih/_om/
translated: khaṃ, hūṃ, traṃ, hrīḥ, oṃ,

original: o/_mam/_bam/_tam/_dzah/_hum/_bam/_hoh/_bcu gsum po 'di rnams 'dab ma'i
analyzed: o/_mam/_bam/_tam/_dzah/_hum/_bam/_hoh/_bcu gsum po 'di rnams 'dab ma'i
translated: aḥ, maṃ, vaṃ, taṃ, jaḥ, hūṃ, vaṃ, hoḥ.

original: zla ba rnams dang sgor gnas pa'i sna tshhogs pad+ma'i nyi ma rnams la dgod par bya'o//
analyzed: zla ba rnams dang sgor gnas pa'i sna tshhogs pad+ma'i nyi ma rnams la dgod par bya'o//
translated: These thirteen are placed on the moon discs in the petals and on the variegated lotus suns in the gates.

original: de'i 'od kyis spyan drangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yi ge de rnams nyid la🔽rab tu gzhug go/_/de la shar gyi 'dab mar bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje sgrol ma
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis spyan drangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yi ge de rnams nyid la rab tu gzhug go/_/de la shar gyi 'dab mar bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje sgrol ma
translated: The tathāgatas invoked by their light are inserted into those syllables.🔽On the petal in the east is the black Bhagavatī Vajra-Tārā, whose nature is Akṣobhya, who has two arms, and holds a vajra and an utpala.

original: nag mo mi skyod pa'i rang bzhin phyag gnyis rdo rje dang ut+pa la 'dzin pa/_lhor
analyzed: nag mo mi skyod pa'i rang bzhin phyag gnyis rdo rje dang ut+pa la 'dzin pa/_lhor
translated: In the south is the yellow Bhagavatī Ratna-Tārā, whose nature is Ratnasaṃbhava, who has two arms, and holds a jewel and an utpala.

original: rin chen sgrol ma ser mo rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin phyag gnyis na rin po🔽che dang ut+pa la 'dzin pa/_nub tu pad ma sgrol ma dmar mo 'od dpag tu med🔽de'i rang bzhin phyag gnyis pa pad ma dang ut+pa la 'dzin pa/_byang du sangs
analyzed: rin chen sgrol ma ser mo rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin phyag gnyis na rin po che dang ut+pa la 'dzin pa/_nub tu pad ma sgrol ma dmar mo 'od dpag tu med de'i rang bzhin phyag gnyis pa pad ma dang ut+pa la 'dzin pa/_byang du sangs
translated: Yellow Ratna Tārā, the nature of Ratnasambhava, holds a jewel and utpala in her two hands.🔽Red Padma Tārā, the nature of Amitābha, is in the west, holding a lotus and utpala in her two hands.

original: rgyas sgrol ma dkar mo rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin 'khor lo dang ut+pa la
analyzed: rgyas sgrol ma dkar mo rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin 'khor lo dang ut+pa la
translated: White Buddha Tārā, the nature of Vairocana, is in the north, holding a wheel and utpala in her two hands.

original: 'dzin pa/_'di rnams dkyil 'khor gyi 'dren ma dang bcas pa lha mo lnga po
analyzed: 'dzin pa/_'di rnams dkyil 'khor gyi 'dren ma dang bcas pa lha mo lnga po
translated: These five goddesses, together with the maṇḍala retinue, are

original: rnams rim pas/_bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang /_shin tu rnam par dag pa
analyzed: rnams rim pas/_bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang /_shin tu rnam par dag pa
translated: respectively the nature of the gnosis of successful activities,🔽the gnosis of the completely pure realm of phenomena,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang /_mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang /_so sor
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang /_mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang /_so sor
translated: the gnosis of uniformity,🔽the gnosis of individual realization,

original: rtog pa'i ye shes dang /_me long lta bu'i ye shes shes bya ba ste ye shes lnga'i rang
analyzed: rtog pa'i ye shes dang /_me long lta bu'i ye shes shes bya ba ste ye shes lnga'i rang
translated: and the gnosis of the mirror.

original: bzhin du bsam par bya'o/_/mer me tog sgrol ma dkar mo me tog gi phreng ba
analyzed: bzhin du bsam par bya'o/_/mer me tog sgrol ma dkar mo me tog gi phreng ba
translated: In the southeast is white Flower Tārā, holding a flower garland.

original: 'dzin pa sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin/_bden bral du bdug spos sgrol ma nag mo
analyzed: 'dzin pa sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin/_bden bral du bdug spos sgrol ma nag mo
translated: The nature of the earth element, which apprehends, is black Dhūpā at Agni.

original: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin/_phyag gnyis na spos phor 'dzin pa/_rlung du mar
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin/_phyag gnyis na spos phor 'dzin pa/_rlung du mar
translated: The nature of the water element, which holds a censer in both hands, is Mā🔽at Vāyu.🔽The nature of the fire element is red Pūrṇā at Nairṛtī, who holds a

original: me sgrol ma dmar mo phyag gnyis mar me'i kong bus mtshhan pa me'i khams kyi rang🔽bzhin/_dbang ldan du dri'i sgrol ma gur gum gyi mdog can dri'i dung chos
analyzed: me sgrol ma dmar mo phyag gnyis mar me'i kong bus mtshhan pa me'i khams kyi rang bzhin/_dbang ldan du dri'i sgrol ma gur gum gyi mdog can dri'i dung chos
translated: lamp in both hands.

original: 'dzin pa rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin can/_shar sgor rdo rje lcags kyu ma nag mo
analyzed: 'dzin pa rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin can/_shar sgor rdo rje lcags kyu ma nag mo
translated: The nature of the wind element, which apprehends, is Gandhā Dhūpā at🔽Īśāna, who is the color of saffron and holds a perfume conch.

original: lcags kyu 'dzin pa dad pa'i dbang po'i rang bzhin g.yas rkyang ba can/_lho🔽sgor rdo rje zhags pa ma ser mo zhags pa 'dzin pa brtshon 'grus kyi dbang po'i rang
analyzed: lcags kyu 'dzin pa dad pa'i dbang po'i rang bzhin g.yas rkyang ba can/_lho sgor rdo rje zhags pa ma ser mo zhags pa 'dzin pa brtshon 'grus kyi dbang po'i rang
translated: The nature of the faith faculty is black Vajrāṅkuśī at the eastern gate,🔽who holds a goad and extends her right leg.🔽The nature of the shame faculty is yellow Vajrapāśī at the southern🔽gate, who holds a noose and extends her right leg.

original: bzhin g.yas brkyang ba can/_nub sgor rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dmar mo lcags
analyzed: bzhin g.yas brkyang ba can/_nub sgor rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dmar mo lcags
translated: The nature of the mindfulness faculty is red Vajrasphoṭā at the western🔽gate, who holds a chain and extends her right leg.

original: sgrog 'dzin pa dran pa'i dbang po'i rang bzhin g.yas brkyang ba can/_byang sgor
analyzed: sgrog 'dzin pa dran pa'i dbang po'i rang bzhin g.yas brkyang ba can/_byang sgor
translated: The nature of the concentration faculty is green Vajrāveśī at the northern🔽gate, who holds a bell and extends her right leg.

original: rdo rje dril bu ma dkar mo rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa/_ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu ma dkar mo rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa/_ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i
translated: She is the nature of the faculty of meditative concentration.🔽She stands with her right leg straight.

original: rang bzhin g.yas brkyang ba can no/_/dkyil 'khor gyi gtsho mo kham yig las skyes🔽pa'i don yod grub pa'i cod pan can no/_/de nas bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi🔽gtsho mo'i snying gar gnas pa'i sa bon tam yig las 'od zer sna tshhogs 'phros pas
analyzed: rang bzhin g.yas brkyang ba can no/_/dkyil 'khor gyi gtsho mo kham yig las skyes pa'i don yod grub pa'i cod pan can no/_/de nas bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtsho mo'i snying gar gnas pa'i sa bon tam yig las 'od zer sna tshhogs 'phros pas
translated: The goddesses of the maṇḍala are born from the khaṃ syllable.🔽They have the crown of Amoghasiddhi.🔽Then, from the tam syllable located at the heart of the goddess of the maṇḍala that is generated,

original: me tog can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams nas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drangs te/
analyzed: me tog can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams nas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drangs te/
translated: various light rays radiate and invite the gnosis maṇḍala from the Flower World.

original: dzah_bam bam hoh_zhes pa'i sngags kyis dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcings pa dang mnyes pa la sogs pa'i rig pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad la bsgom
analyzed: dzah_bam bam hoh_zhes pa'i sngags kyis dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcings pa dang mnyes pa la sogs pa'i rig pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad la bsgom
translated: With the mantras jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, one should meditate on the maṇḍala wheel with the awareness of summoning, inducting, binding, and delighting.

original: par bya'o/_/de nas dbang bskur ba bzung ba'i don du spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha
analyzed: par bya'o/_/de nas dbang bskur ba bzung ba'i don du spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha
translated: Then, in order to take the empowerment, one should meditate on Locanā and so on

original: mo'i tshhogs spyan drangs te/_om ah_sarba ta tha ga ta b+hi she ka pa ma ya shri ye hum/
analyzed: mo'i tshhogs spyan drangs te/_om ah_sarba ta tha ga ta b+hi she ka pa ma ya shri ye hum/
translated: Invite the assembly with:🔽oṃ aḥ🔽sarva tathāgata abhiṣekha pāmaya śrīye hūṃ

original: om sarba ta tha ga ta badzra de byo ma ma b+hi shiny+tshan+tu swa ha/_zhes pa'i sngags kyis dbang
analyzed: om sarba ta tha ga ta badzra de byo ma ma b+hi shiny+tshan+tu swa ha/_zhes pa'i sngags kyis dbang
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata vajra devī abhiṣiñcantu svāhā

original: sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs/
analyzed: sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs/
translated: Take the empowerment.

original: bskur ba bzung bas rang lha mo sgrol ma'i rang gzugs yin yang rnal 'byor pa'i
analyzed: bskur ba bzung bas rang lha mo sgrol ma'i rang gzugs yin yang rnal 'byor pa'i
translated: Even though you are the very embodiment of the deity Tārā,🔽in order to increase the accumulation of merit of the practitioner,

original: bsod nams kyi tshhogs mngon par 'phel ba'i slad du phyi'i dkyil 'khor spro bar
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshhogs mngon par 'phel ba'i slad du phyi'i dkyil 'khor spro bar
translated: you should emanate the outer maṇḍala.🔽The mantras for that are:

original: bya ste/_de la sngags rnams ni/_om ta re tut+ta re tu re swa ha/_zhes pa'i rtsha
analyzed: bya ste/_de la sngags rnams ni/_om ta re tut+ta re tu re swa ha/_zhes pa'i rtsha
translated: oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā🔽is the mantra of the central deity.

original: ba'i sngags kyi dbus su dkyil 'khor gyi 'dren ma'o/_/shar du/_om badzra ta re
analyzed: ba'i sngags kyi dbus su dkyil 'khor gyi 'dren ma'o/_/shar du/_om badzra ta re
translated: In the east: oṃ vajra tāre svāhā🔽In the south: oṃ ratna tāre svāhā

original: swa ha/_lhor om rat+na ta re swa ha/_nub tu om pad+ma ta re swa ha/_byang du om
analyzed: swa ha/_lhor om rat+na ta re swa ha/_nub tu om pad+ma ta re swa ha/_byang du om
translated: In the west: oṃ padma tāre svāhā🔽In the north: oṃ karma tāre svāhā

original: bud+d+ha ta re swa ha/_mer om push+pa ta re swa ha/_bden bral du/_om d+hu pa ta re
analyzed: bud+d+ha ta re swa ha/_mer om push+pa ta re swa ha/_bden bral du/_om d+hu pa ta re
translated: In the southwest: Oṃ dhūpa-Tara, svāhā.🔽In the northwest: Oṃ dīpa-Tara, svāhā.

original: swa ha/_rlung du/_om di pa ta re swa ha/_dbang ldan du/_om gan+d+ha ta re swa ha/🔽shar sgor/_om dzah_ku shi hu~m phat swa ha/_lho sgor/_o hum badzra pa shi hum
analyzed: swa ha/_rlung du/_om di pa ta re swa ha/_dbang ldan du/_om gan+d+ha ta re swa ha/ shar sgor/_om dzah_ku shi hu~m phat swa ha/_lho sgor/_o hum badzra pa shi hum
translated: In the northeast: Oṃ gandha-Tara, svāhā.🔽 In the eastern gate: Oṃ jaḥ kuśa huṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽 In the southern gate: Oṃ huṃ vajra-pāśa huṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: phat swa ha/_nub sgor/_om bam badzra spo ta hum phat swa ha/_byang sgor/_om ho
analyzed: phat swa ha/_nub sgor/_om bam badzra spo ta hum phat swa ha/_byang sgor/_om ho
translated: In the western gate: Oṃ vaṃ vajra-sphoṭa huṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽 In the northern gate: Oṃ hoḥ vajra-ghaṇḍe huṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: badzra g+han+ne hu~m phat swa ha/_zhes pa sgo'i lha mo bzhi po ste/_sngags 'di rnams
analyzed: badzra g+han+ne hu~m phat swa ha/_zhes pa sgo'i lha mo bzhi po ste/_sngags 'di rnams
translated: These are the four gate goddesses.

original: kyis dkyil 'khor pa byas te bdug spos dang sgrol ma la sogs par dbul bar
analyzed: kyis dkyil 'khor pa byas te bdug spos dang sgrol ma la sogs par dbul bar
translated: Having made the maṇḍala with these mantras, offer incense and so on to Tārā and so forth.

original: bya'o/_/'dir gtor ma'i sngags ni/_om ta re su ta re da ha da ha sarba pa san
analyzed: bya'o/_/'dir gtor ma'i sngags ni/_om ta re su ta re da ha da ha sarba pa san
translated: Here the mantra for the bali offering is: Oṃ tāre su tāre daha daha sarva-pāpa

original: pa tsha pa tsha ku ru ku ru/_sarba b+hu ta san+tarba rde/_ta ra ta ra ta ra ya ta ra ya/
analyzed: pa tsha pa tsha ku ru ku ru/_sarba b+hu ta san+tarba rde/_ta ra ta ra ta ra ya ta ra ya/
translated: saṃpāca pāca kuru kuru sarva-bhūta-santāpa-tarpaṇa taraya taraya tāraya tāraya.

original: sarba duhkha ma han+na we b+h+yoh mam sarba satam h+pha sa ma ya ma nu sma ra i ba ba pra pra swa ha/
analyzed: sarba duhkha ma han+na we b+h+yoh mam sarba satam h+pha sa ma ya ma nu sma ra i ba ba pra pra swa ha/
translated: sarva duḥkha mahānvighna bhyo haṃ sarva satvaṃ phaṭ samaya manupasmarā evaṃ pra pra svāhā.🔽This is the mantra of the torma.

original: zhes pa gtor ma'i sngags so/_/de nas las thams cad pa'i gtor ma'i sngags🔽bri bar bya'o/_/ji ltar na/_om brah+ma ca/_de wa tah/_sar+tha in+ta tah/_lo🔽ka rak+sha kah/_na gagan+d+harba/_yak+sha  tram s+yan+tu/_ba li na sa da/_om a ka ro
analyzed: zhes pa gtor ma'i sngags so/_/de nas las thams cad pa'i gtor ma'i sngags bri bar bya'o/_/ji ltar na/_om brah+ma ca/_de wa tah/_sar+tha in+ta tah/_lo ka rak+sha kah/_na gagan+d+harba/_yak+sha  tram s+yan+tu/_ba li na sa da/_om a ka ro
translated: Then, the mantra of the torma of all activities should be written.

original: mu kham sarba d+harma na ma d+ya nup+pan+na twad/_om ahhum phat swa ha/_zhes pa ni las
analyzed: mu kham sarba d+harma na ma d+ya nup+pan+na twad/_om ahhum phat swa ha/_zhes pa ni las
translated: How? Oṃ brahma ca, deva taha, sarva anta taha, loka rakṣa kaha, nāga gandharva yakṣa tam syantu, baliṃ sadad, oṃ akaro mukhaṃ sarva dharmāṇāṃ namo’nupadṛṣṭa tvaṃ oṃ aḥ huṃ phaṭ svāhā.🔽This is the torma of all activities.

original: thams cad pa'i gtor ma'o/_/de nas smon lam gyi tshhigs su bcad pa brjod de/
analyzed: thams cad pa'i gtor ma'o/_/de nas smon lam gyi tshhigs su bcad pa brjod de/
translated: Then, recite the verses of aspiration.🔽Oṃ vajra muḥ.

original: om badzra mu_zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rang gi lus la gzhug go//
analyzed: om badzra mu_zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rang gi lus la gzhug go//
translated: With this mantra, the maṇḍala wheel should be brought into one’s body.🔽Oṃ bhūta gaṇa muḥ.

original: om b+hu ta ga na mu_zhes pas gtor ma'i 'gron gshegs su gsol lo/_/ji srid
analyzed: om b+hu ta ga na mu_zhes pas gtor ma'i 'gron gshegs su gsol lo/_/ji srid
translated: With this, the guests of the torma should be requested to depart.

original: mi skyo ba'i bar du/_rtsha ba'i sngags dang /_om ta re tut+ta re tu re d+ha nam me da
analyzed: mi skyo ba'i bar du/_rtsha ba'i sngags dang /_om ta re tut+ta re tu re d+ha nam me da
translated: Recite the mantra of the hot one,🔽om tare tuttare ture dhanam me dehi svahā,🔽and the mantra of the giver of wealth,

original: da swa ha/_zhes pa'i sngags bzlas par bya'o/_/sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i
analyzed: da swa ha/_zhes pa'i sngags bzlas par bya'o/_/sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i
translated: om tare tuttare ture vaśaṃ kuru svahā.🔽The sādhana of Tārā the Giver of Wealth,

original: bsgrub thabs pan+di ta chen po sa ha dza shris mdzad pa rdzogs so//_//
analyzed: bsgrub thabs pan+di ta chen po sa ha dza shris mdzad pa rdzogs so//_//
translated: composed by the great paṇḍita Sahājaśrī, is complete.

original: mkhyen rab dang thugs rje rab kyi phul du byung ba dpag tu med pas spras pa
analyzed: mkhyen rab dang thugs rje rab kyi phul du byung ba dpag tu med pas spras pa
translated: Adorned with immeasurable, excellent wisdom and compassion,

original: chos rje bla ma dam pa spyan snga rin po che grags pa byang chub rgyal mtshhan dpal
analyzed: chos rje bla ma dam pa spyan snga rin po che grags pa byang chub rgyal mtshhan dpal
translated: the holy lord of dharma, the precious lord of the face, Drakpa Jangchup Gyaltsen Pal🔽Zangpo,

original: bzang po'i bka' lung dang /_dpon po grags pa rin chen gyi gsung bzhin du/
analyzed: bzang po'i bka' lung dang /_dpon po grags pa rin chen gyi gsung bzhin du/
translated: and at the request of the lord Drakpa Rinchen,🔽the inner minister of Nedong, with abundant provisions,

original: sne gdong nang so nas yo byad phun sum tshhogs pa stshal te gnas de nyid du/_kha
analyzed: sne gdong nang so nas yo byad phun sum tshhogs pa stshal te gnas de nyid du/_kha
translated: in that very place,

original: che'i pan+di ta chen po ku ma ra shri b+ha tra dang /_bod kyi lotsh+tshha ba nam mkha' bzang
analyzed: che'i pan+di ta chen po ku ma ra shri b+ha tra dang /_bod kyi lotsh+tshha ba nam mkha' bzang
translated: the great Indian paṇḍita Kumāraśrībhādra and the Tibetan lotsāwa Namkha Sangpo

original: pos bsgyur ba'o/_/ 'di yi brgyud pa ni/_rje btshun ma sgrol ma/_ma ha pan+di ta sa ha dza shri/
analyzed: pos bsgyur ba'o/_/ 'di yi brgyud pa ni/_rje btshun ma sgrol ma/_ma ha pan+di ta sa ha dza shri/
translated: the great scholar Sahasrabhuja,🔽the great scholar Kumarashribhadra,

original: ma ha pan+di ta ku ma ra shri b+ha dra/_ma ha lotsh+tshha ba nam mkha' bzang po/_ma ha🔽lotsh+tshha ba thugs rje dpal la'o/_/
analyzed: ma ha pan+di ta ku ma ra shri b+ha dra/_ma ha lotsh+tshha ba nam mkha' bzang po/_ma ha lotsh+tshha ba thugs rje dpal la'o/_/
translated: the great lotsawa Namkha Sangpo,🔽and the lotsawa Thukje Pal.

original: ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs/
analyzed: ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs/
translated: Sādhana of the Unerring Giver
